title: M2 NASTY
data:
- *For the "nasties" summoned by high-level monster spellcasters, see [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties#Nasties "Summon nasties").*

The **M2\_NASTY** monster flag influences[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) the [experience points](/wiki/Experience_points#Experience_points_from_killing_monsters "Experience points") killing a monster gains you[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) and what [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") they might be generated with.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

This flag is completely unrelated to the "nasties" summoned by the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") monster spell.

The following monsters are M2\_NASTY:

- h [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer")
- h [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")
- w [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm")
- w [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm")
- J [jabberwock](/wiki/Jabberwock "Jabberwock")
- Y [owlbear](/wiki/Owlbear "Owlbear")
- Z [skeleton](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton")
- @ [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest")
- @ [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")
- @ [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus")
-   [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")
- all [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being")
- all adult [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- all [giant humanoids](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid")
- all [vampires](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire")
- all [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") (including lords and princes)
- the [Riders](/wiki/Rider "Rider")
- the [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master")
- all [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") (the [Master of Thieves](/wiki/Master_of_Thieves "Master of Thieves") @ only if actually acting as your quest nemesis, *not* as [rogue quest](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest") leader)

## SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the following monsters also have the M2\_NASTY flag set:

- a [tsetse fly](/wiki/Tsetse_fly "Tsetse fly")
- n [quickling](/wiki/Quickling "Quickling")
- q [catoblepas](/wiki/Catoblepas "Catoblepas")
- s [carrion crawler](/wiki/Carrion_crawler "Carrion crawler")
- w [rot worm](/wiki/Rot_worm "Rot worm")
- z [kangaroo](/wiki/Kangaroo "Kangaroo")
- J [vorpal jabberwock](/wiki/Vorpal_jabberwock "Vorpal jabberwock")
- P [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)")
- P [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth")
-   [shadow](/wiki/Shadow "Shadow")
- : [rhaumbusun](/wiki/Rhaumbusun "Rhaumbusun")
- all new angelic beings
- all new adult dragons, including D [wyverns](/wiki/Wyvern "Wyvern") and D [hydras](/wiki/Hydra "Hydra")
- all new vampires
- all new major demons, except spined devils
- all new quest nemeses
- u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare "Nightmare"), e [Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(monster\) "Beholder (monster)") and L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")
- all other new unique monsters (except [One-Eyed Sam](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\)#One-eyed_Sam "Black market (SLASH'EM)"))

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"What was changed in UnNetHack?"*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mondata.h in NetHack 3.4.3, line 103](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/mondata.h#line103 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/mondata.h"): *extra\_nasty() macro detects M2\_NASTY*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 84](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/exper.c#line84 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/exper.c"): *extra\_nasty() grants extra experience*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 431](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/makemon.c#line431 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/makemon.c"): *extra\_nasty() biases towards better weapons*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [trap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2039](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/trap.c#line2039 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/trap.c"): *extra\_nasty() discerns adult dragons from baby dragons to let them tear through webs*

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
M2_NASTY

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the "nasties" summoned by high-level monster spellcasters, see summon nasties.

The M2_NASTY monster flag influences[1] the experience points killing a monster gains you[2] and what weapons they might be generated with.[3]

This flag is completely unrelated to the "nasties" summoned by the summon nasties monster spell.

The following monsters are M2_NASTY:

  • h mind flayer
  • h master mind flayer
  • w long worm
  • w purple worm
  • J jabberwock
  • Y owlbear
  • Z skeleton
  • @ high priest
  • @ Wizard of Yendor
  • @ Croesus
  •   shade
  • all angelic beings
  • all adult dragons[4]
  • all giant humanoids
  • all vampires
  • all major demons (including lords and princes)
  • the Riders
  • the Grand Master
  • all quest nemeses (the Master of Thieves @ only if actually acting as your quest nemesis, not as rogue quest leader)

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the following monsters also have the M2_NASTY flag set:

  • a tsetse fly
  • n quickling
  • q catoblepas
  • s carrion crawler
  • w rot worm
  • z kangaroo
  • J vorpal jabberwock
  • P shoggoth
  • P giant shoggoth
  •   shadow
  • : rhaumbusun
  • all new angelic beings
  • all new adult dragons, including D wyverns and D hydras
  • all new vampires
  • all new major demons, except spined devils
  • all new quest nemeses
  • u Nightmare, e Beholder and L Vecna
  • all other new unique monsters (except One-Eyed Sam)

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"What was changed in UnNetHack?"

References

  1. ↑ mondata.h in NetHack 3.4.3, line 103: extra_nasty() macro detects M2_NASTY
  2. ↑ exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 84: extra_nasty() grants extra experience
  3. ↑ makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 431: extra_nasty() biases towards better weapons
  4. ↑ trap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2039: extra_nasty() discerns adult dragons from baby dragons to let them tear through webs

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.
